title: The Rig Veda: Ancient Wisdom
content:
The oldest surviving Vedic text
Composed in Sanskrit, around 1500 BCE
Contains hymns, prayers, and rituals
image_desc: An illustration depicting ancient India with a scroll of the Rig Veda.
narration: The Rig Veda is a cornerstone of Hinduism, offering a glimpse into ancient Indian culture and beliefs. It's the oldest surviving Vedic text, composed in Sanskrit around fifteen hundred BCE. The Rig Veda is a collection of hymns, prayers, and rituals, offering insights into the lives, beliefs, and aspirations of the people of that era.
